org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode

Class HardwareLightbot

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.HardwareLightbot

  • public class HardwareLightbot
extends java.lang.Object
    This hardware class is for LightBot, the new robot. It declares and defines all hardware components on the robot, as well as provides control abstractions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void backward()
      This method makes the robot go at full speed backward by setting all of the motor powers to -1.0.
      void forward()
      This method makes the robot go at full speed forward by setting all of the motor powers to 1.0.
      void setDriveZeroPowerBehavior(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior behavior)
      This method sets the drive behavior of what one of the drive motors of the robot are to do when its power is set to zero.
      void setPowers(double power)
      This method sets all of the motors to specific given power.
      void stopMoving()
      This method stops the movement of the drive motors.
      void strafe(org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.Dir direction, double power)
      This method sets the powers of the motors in a way that will strafe the robot in a given direction.
      void tank(double left, double right)
      This method takes two powers and sets the left motors to a given power and a right motors to a given power respectively.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HardwareLightbot

        public HardwareLightbot(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap map)
        Class constructor. Returns a new instance of HardwareLightbot. The constructor also defines all declared hardware components on execution.
        Parameters:
        map - The hardware map of the class instance of the callee to be assigned to the instance of hardware.

    • Method Detail

      • tank

        public void tank(double left,
                 double right)
        This method takes two powers and sets the left motors to a given power and a right motors to a given power respectively.
        Parameters:
        left - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which determines the speed that the left motors will be set to.
        right - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which determines the speed that the right motors will be set to.

      • strafe

        public void strafe(org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.Dir direction,
                   double power)
        This method sets the powers of the motors in a way that will strafe the robot in a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - A Dir enumeration which states which direction the robot will strafe.
        power - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which represents the speed at which the robot is to strafe.

      • forward

        public void forward()
        This method makes the robot go at full speed forward by setting all of the motor powers to 1.0.

      • stopMoving

        public void stopMoving()
        This method stops the movement of the drive motors. If the motors are set to brake on zero power the robot will stop in place.

      • backward

        public void backward()
        This method makes the robot go at full speed backward by setting all of the motor powers to -1.0.

      • setPowers

        public void setPowers(double power)
        This method sets all of the motors to specific given power.
        Parameters:
        power - A double between -1.0 and 1.0 which represents the speed that the motors will be set to.

      • setDriveZeroPowerBehavior

        public void setDriveZeroPowerBehavior(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior behavior)
        This method sets the drive behavior of what one of the drive motors of the robot are to do when its power is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        behavior - A ZeroPowerBehavior enumeration (Under DcMotor) which will be applied to all of the drive motors of the robot.
